contentencoded:
In 1962, James Meredith launched a one-man crusade to integrate the University of Mississippi, also known as Ole Miss. Today, he has a new mission to reform American public education.


Guest: James Meredith, the first African American student at the University of Mississippi and co-author of A Mission From God: A Memoir and Challenge for America.


Guest: William Doyle, journalist and co-author of A Mission From God: A Memoir and Challenge for America.


For more on James Meredith’s education reform ideas, visit his Facebook page.
